entry.title: Attention
entry.summary:
Author: LicoricexWitch

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,788Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 129

Summary: You've always been obsessed with superheroes, ever since you were a little kid. You moved to Gotham all alone with stars in your eyes for undergrad before the cold reality of city-living set in. The streets were mean and people weren't as kind as they were back home. It was hard to make friends and you preferred to stay inside, making you even lonelier. You were a regular fish out of water, not a lot of close friends or family, living all alone--the perfect target for someone with not-so-nice intentions. They always said not to meet your heroes because they could never live up to your expectations. Or sometimes, they weren't a hero at all.

entry.title: People Aren't Good
entry.summary:
Author: Miss_nightshade

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,900Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 82

Summary: Hecate has spent her life tucked into the bruised edges of Gotham’s Narrows, pretending to be a small, harmless girl with nothing worth noticing. It’s a fragile lie, but it holds. She goes to school. She walks home alone. She returns to a house that feels older than she is, a place that hums with magic she refuses to touch. She keeps her power buried. She ignores the ancient voices whispering inside her. She does everything she can to stay unseen. And for years, it works. Until the night it doesn’t.

entry.title: It shouldn't bother you...
entry.summary:
Author: Honey_bellie

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,476Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 11

Summary: You have just moved into Gotham a few months ago, you have a new house, a teaching job at a new school, a new sense of normality. Its was true that you had runned away from your old life, but that didn't matter anymore, new begginings. Still you couldn't help but feel something is wrong with this city, shit keeps happening to you and something was telling you wasn't just for the fact you were in the number one "avoid at all costs living here" city. You were definitely getting involved with the wrong people, Red Hood, you should be scared of him, but he keeps showing up at the right time when you need him. Still, you had Jason, right? Although you could feel he was hiding some secrets from you, not that you could blame him because you were doing the same...Authors note: Reader is a really unlucky girl when it comes to be put in dangerous situations as you will notice along that way, but now she has a certain someone watching over her. He falls first and harder. There ought to be some angst along the way, they are two broken people learning how to love and loved. Reader has a mysterious past that will be revealed bit by bit, I'm trying to leave clues so you guys can theorize about it. Its planned to be a long fic.

entry.title: You, Me, and the 192-Day Streak
entry.summary:
Author: keiflrt

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,556Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 28

Summary: A notification pops up from the top of your screen. Nothing to be worried about, maybe it was one of your streakmates trying to get a head start in keeping the streak alive. But dead streakmates don’t exactly … reply on TikTok now, do they? entry.title: i'd tell you i love you, but then i'd have to kill you
entry.summary:
Author: in_violet_hues

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,390Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 51

Summary: There's a war against Gotham. Guess which side of it you're on? The Arkham Knight's. Under covert circumstances involving Deathstroke, you've been assigned a "special" role, where you operate outside the militia's hierarchy. And it's all thanks to the "unique skills" you possess. That means you have no rank, no restrictions, and an unspoken agreement that would probably turn the entire militia against you. There are just a few problems:- You answer only to the Knight.- You don't like each other (makes the first point difficult).- Also, he's the same guy you hooked up with on your first night in Gotham (makes everything difficult). You're off to a great start. OR: You unknowingly had a one-night stand with your new commander. You try really, really hard not to let it happen again. [No use of Y/N but a codename/nickname will be used]

entry.title: delayed satisfaction is the sweetest
entry.summary:
Author: dreamtiming

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,380Chapters: 3/4Kudos: 109

Summary: “That’s why you keep asking to go on patrol with me, right? My cutting intellect?” He asks, dipping a fry from his takeout box in a pool of ketchup. You wonder if the splotch on his sleeve is from a rather exuberant dip, or if it’s blood from earlier. “Among other things.” You say, feeling like it’s finally your turn to offer someone an ambiguous response. Especially as he returns to this topic of conversation he is so insistent on having out with you. For emphasis, you take a great bite of your food to allot you more time to muster defenses. “What other things?” Jason presses, because it might work with someone else—but not him, who, with no protection of the mask to guide his face, bores his eyes into you. “Like the fact that you paid for the food.” You offer gleefully, both of you knowing this is unsatisfactory. “Can’t be the only thing.” He says, his tone surprisingly level. Why on earth is your heart beating so fast? tl;dr: stuck in the middle with you. Dick Grayson/Reader/Jason Todd

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,901Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 751

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: What We Could Be
entry.summary:
Author: SaltyJoy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,243Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 41

Summary: There was a point where you liked Dick Grayson as a kid, but you knew he never reciprocated those feelings, so you forced yourself to move on. When Dick finds out years later, he can't help but feel conflicted. Struggling with his own feelings, he wonders if he is too late to figure out his own. Do you still love him, or does he need to win you back? Chapter two is the Dick Grayson ending, and chapter three is the Jason Todd ending. Pick your poison, or just read both.

entry.title: Another Star in Gotham's sky (Keep shining and maybe I will see you)
entry.summary:
Author: mellewyin

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,195Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 11

Summary: “Hey, star…” Jason paused, deliberately, cautious, trying to be as controlled as never, knowing he would catch if Jason slipped his fear. “Yeah?” The boy answered, not quite paying attention, too busy washing the dishes from their last meal. Jason tries to count how many times he faced this exact scene, how many times he sat on this exact counter, eating as he saw the college student doing some domestic activity while the speaker played an old song (actually, was it jazz? was it blues? what the heck was it playing anyway?). It kind of made him hesitate more — not from discomfort, not really. It was something… something softer. Gentler even (When was the last time he felt someone being gentle with him? Jason doesn’t even need to think. He knows it was with him. Always with him.) It somehow made the things worse, made the ache on his heart hurt more, the thorns on his throat sting more. Still, he needed to ask. “Why…” Oh God, why was it so difficult? “Why you keep taking care of me?" He didn’t want to hear the answer, he already knew, and it was what he hated more.AKA civilian!reader taking care of Red Hood injuries every night <3

entry.title: An Ode to reunions
entry.summary:
Author: Fung1cida

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,763Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: She had thought, all those years, that she was just crazy. The doctors explained so. Schizophrenia tends to runs in the families. She can’t run faster than that. But if it was only that, just bad hallucinations, why did Jason die at the end? He was just another lost kid in the same street she lived at. She still lives there. If it was just mommy’s illness, why did she feel him die in her own bones? Even worse: why did she feel him come back to life? Or, Red Hood meets a probably neurotic woman obssesed with the idea she could have stopped his death. Jason Todd comes back to life and it feels like it alwats did in the begining: forceful, miserable, and confusing.
